Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2007 12:25PM yuyubear wrote: I am large breasted and lumpy and am having both removed, since I did not want to ever have to go thru the uncertainty of knowing what was going on in the other one (first one found really late), and for symmetry.  In the US, the gov't requires insurance companies to pay for reconstructing the good side to match, so it is not additional cost. Ultimately it is a personal choice for each person.  best of luck to your mom! YH in NJ
Posts.Title: Remove both?? oilcandani Beesie

Posts.Content: yuyubear wrote: I'm almost 6 weeks post BLM, negative sentinel nodes, stage 1 er+/pr+/her 2 neg cancer, getting expanded.  There was a lot of dcis (> 4 cm), and multiple areas (more than 10) of little (1-2 mm) areas of invasion within that.  THere was not enough to get an Oncotype sample, which is sort of good and bad since we can not test the DNA.  My primary onc originally said just tamoxifen no chemo (yea!) but then I got a 2nd opinion from a leading cancer center which I need to discuss with my onc next week. My 2nd opinion said I should do some chemo but CMF is probably fine, followed by hormone therapy, instead of AC or TC type therapy.  CMF would be 6 months (vs. 3 of DD AC) and I was planning my expander exchange before that! They are not the most comfy things... BUT i am supposed to go back to work in Jan and really thought I could keep most of my hair and not get so sick again... Does anyone even get CMF anymore???  I really do not know how I am going to decide if have a choice of regimens... Any advice is appreciated. YH in NJ  Dx 8/8/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: anyone still being given CMF? yuyubear OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: yuyubear wrote: I find reading all these comments sooooooo helpful! I was dx august 8th and am finally getting around to having BL mastectomy oct 22nd!  My breast felt no different the first month after diagnosis, but over the past several weeks I definitely feel it is bigger and I have tightness in my back, lots of tingling in back ands along collar bone, and some soreness under my arm (not in the pit but more over the ribs).  My surgeon says it feels the same as last month, this is just hormonal and tension.  Also occasional pain in the breast, surgeon says this could be delayed post-biopsy healing pain, or a nerve grew in there. my core biopsy in aug showed widespread insitu and some invasive component, ductolubular, grade 2, er+/pr+, her2-. MRI 6 cm enhancement, PET/CT showed 2.5 cm in the breast.   I am paranoid this is taking over since my hormones are raging from the stress.... Anyone with similar symptoms, should I be worried???? Also, should I be concerned that a SLN biopsy was not done on me once the original dx came in? YH in NJ Dx 8/8/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: weird symptoms lately yuyubear Shirlann

Posts.Content: yuyubear wrote: Hi All, I am a 42 yo Dx early this august on core biopsy, invasive and insitu ductolobular, ER+, PR+, Her-.  The path report from core said 1 mm invasive component, but the in situ seems allover.  Finally got MRI mid, enhancing mass is 6cm but not assoc with skin or chest wall.  Pet/CT last week was negative, so I am waiting on a mastectomy date. Nodes unknown at this time, until surgery.  Is it ok if my surgeon makes me wait a few weeks???  How soon after my mastectomy can I start chemo, should I need it (probably will...). My first chat, hope to hear from you soon! -YH in NJ Dx 8/8/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Too long to surg? How soon after mastectomy can I start chemo? yuyubear 3boys4me

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2007 10:28PM yuyubear wrote: Hey D1, I start Dec 27 also! 4 x tc every 3 weeks, no port!.  Picked out a wig yesterday, hope to do a Look Good Feel BEtter next year, they said there are no more this year.  My med cabinet already stocked up with my chemo meds. Back to work Jan 2, desk job, hope it works out. Good luck to us! yh in NJ
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2007 08:23PM yuyubear wrote: THanks Desny, that was helpful. I am in bergen county, new milford.  ARe you near by?  -YH
Posts.Title: anyone still being given CMF? yuyubear OneBadBoob

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2007 06:30PM yuyubear wrote: UGH!  D1 et al, my node arm is killing me too since the shot. today i felt like a fog all day, felt really bad for my little kid, could not do a thing active with him.  Made myself march one mile on treadmill after some coffee this AM, but not sure I will get back on again tonite.   I was really up from those steroids around chemo day. maybe I did too much stretching before chemo, to relax, then the day after I was still on steroids and went to PT and did more upper arm stuff.  I think my tissue expander (total PITA, if you know that acronym. and the A is not armpit), is slipping and that is poking me, we will see PS tomorrow to check.  At least no nausea or vomiting altho not much appetite during day, more around dinner.   Does this immediate crappy feeling go away soon, or get worse??  Saw the Kite Runner movie last night, excellent by the way. YH in NJ
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2008 07:04PM yuyubear wrote: Veggetal, D1 is right on about the SEs from the CT.  Take those steroids, yes you may have trouble sleeping the night before your chemo, but you can accomplish a lot while you still have the energy.  the next you may be so tired from lack of sleep previous nite you will crash anyway. the steroids keep you going for about a day after the last dose too.  DOn't get hungry, keep saltines or something by your bed in case you wake up early in the AM and are quesy.  Good luck! For me on TC every 3 wks  x 4(did 2nd round past thursday, hey half done!), first round I crashed on sunday, so this time around I made sure the fridge was stocked and all errands and laundry done before, and made childcare arrangements for the crash day, which actually did not really come this 2nd time around.  BAd now is the dry mouth, no taste, and dry eyes.  some mild tingling/numbness in toes too.  hair thing sucks too FUBC. can't wait till it at least all falls out so my head slides on the pillow.  Got my franken boobs blown up for the final time day before chemo too, so that does not help..... Sorry gals I was out of the loop for a while, hope we are all going strong!  Anybody have stuffy ear side effects??? -Yuyubear
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2007 06:23AM yuyubear wrote: Hi late Dec/jan 08 chemo gals, HAd my first t/c (taxotere cytoxan) on Dec 27th, the infusions themselves really non eventful, except they kept using my right arm for the vital signs, where i had some lymph nodes removed. Will have to insist on them using my leg for BPs next time.  Steriods totally pumped me up so when I thought I would come home and crash, I went to the supermarket to stock up on stuff, today i am off the decadron so we will see.  Last Emend today, no queasiness so far, just eating lots of veggies and protein.  Yesterday got the Neunasty (neulasta) shot so just waiting for some of those side effects... How is everyone else doing, D1 et al? YH in NJ
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63
